page.title: 08St Annes - Tourist Interview
page.content: People staying in hotels thought them good value in view of good food and entertainment.One family in holiday flats thought them expensive, another in a Blackpool flat was pleased.Caravans were also seen as good value.There was plenty for children to do it was thought: parks, the beach,miniature- railway, and trampolines.But teenagers were more difficult to accommodate.The visitors thought the locals to be friendly and helpful although one found them 'rather off hand'.People found drinks to be more expensive, otherwise things were similar in price. Only one person would not come again,all the others enjoyed their holiday.Most people compared St Annes favourably with other holiday resorts, in Britain as being more relaxed,not brash 'just right for us'.
